info.name: Ontoserver 6: example FHIR Terminology requests
info.description:
Example usage of FHIR Terminology Services

You will need to set the global variable url to your FHIR endpoint.

For Ontoserver, set it to

https://r4.ontoserver.csiro.au/fhir

item.name: AuditEvent Examples

request.description: Create an AuditEvent resource to indicate the selection of a code following a search (ValueSet $expand with filter)

item.description: Examples demonstrating the use of the AuditEvent resource

request.description: The request sends two lookups - one of a LOINC code and one of a SNOMED CT code.
Adding an initial concept to the table should not generate an entry in the resulting ConceptMap.

exec: tests["ConceptMap is not empty"] = typeof jsonData.group !== 'undefined';

request.description: Adding a second concept to the table should generate an entry in the resulting ConceptMap.
Adding multiple extra concepts may result in multiple maps.
Reset to version 0 should give us all the edges computed so far.

item.name: Search all CodeSystems, return their names and urls

request.description: Reads the latest version of a CodeSystem

item.name: Search all CodeSystems with URLs starting with http://snomed.info
Create a ConceptMap (using a POST) from XML

body.raw:
Procedure map

Procedure map.url

Procedure map

 <status value="draft"/> <experimental value="true"/> <publisher value="me"/> <date value="2016-07-21"/> <description value="Procedure map"/> <copyright value="copy"/> <group> <source value="urn:Procedures.url"/> <target value="http://snomed.info/sct"/> <element> <code value="1"/> <target> <code value="133860004"/> <equivalence value="inexact"/> </target> </element> <element> <code value="2"/> <target> <code value="133860004"/> <equivalence value="inexact"/> </target> </element> <element> <code value="3"/> <target> <code value="119631007"/> <equivalence value="inexact"/> </target> </element> </group> </ConceptMap>

request.description: Unlike a PUT, which will update a resource if it doesn't already exist, a POST will only create a new resource. The resource body (XML in this case) and the URL must not specify an ID (the ID will be generated by the server).

item.name: Read a specific version of a Concept Map, in XML
Search for ConceptMaps with names containing 'edu'

request.description:
This requests expands an implicit SNOMED CT ValueSet and applies a filter ('filter=met')
Only the first 10 results are requested ('count=10')

item.name: Expand List of SCT-AU Reference Sets in JSON
Expand SCT-AU Medicinal product reference set in XML
Expand implicit value set of all concepts subsumed by General Anaesthesia Procedure
Expand SCT-AU ValueSet with boost factors

request.description:
Expand a ValueSet where different elements of the ValueSet are modified by "boost factors".

Bosting factors are specified using the extension http://ontoserver.csiro.au/profiles/boost

item.name: Lookup 2 properties: display and inactive status
Lookup a code's inactive status using a Coding (POST)
Validate a ValueSet on the server
Check that a Coding exists in a SNOMED refset

request.description: This sends a simple search request to the ValueSet endpoint to find all available ValueSet definitions.
This sends a simple search request to the ValueSet endpoint to find all available ValueSet definitions.

This creates a ValueSet
(or updates it, if it already exists)

item.name: Create/Update a ValueSet using a filter and excludes
